meanings.definition: cliffiest: superlative form of cliffy, having many cliffs
meanings.sent1: The cliffiest coastline I've ever seen was in that painting.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range had the cliffiest peaks, making it a challenging climb.
meanings.sent3: The cliffiest part of the hike was when we had to scramble up the steep rocks.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as cliffiest as the tallest cliff, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The cliffiest cliffs towered above us, casting long shadows over the valley.

meanings.definition: cliffiest: most cliff-like in appearance or structure
meanings.sent1: The cliffiest rock formation in the park resembled a giant castle turret.
meanings.sent2: The cliffiest edge of the canyon jutted out dramatically into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cliffiest part of the movie set was the fake cliff they built for the action scene.
meanings.sent4: His jawline was as cliffiest as a rugged cliff face, sharp and defined.
meanings.sent5: The cliffiest building in the city stood tall and imposing, a true architectural marvel.
